result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad B Unferth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF706

superMiscConds.notes:
No Contact with T.K., M.H., D.C., S.T., or C.B. or any of their residences. No Contact with St. Jerome's Church.  Follow through with any AODA treatment, counseling. No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

to Amend Judgment of Conviction filed by defendant.

  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 03/24/21 because that is the date it was mailed.

 **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 04/01/21--Motion denied without a hearing or further consideration as the sentencing court has already addressed eligibility for programs. Defendant Chad B Unferth in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Statements by M.H. and D.C.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) CONSECUTIVE to 15CF706.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  No contact with T.K., M.H., D.C., S.T., or C.B. or any of their residences.  No contact with St. Jerome's Church.  Pay restitution in 15CF706.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant Chad B Unferth in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests an adjournment to work on a global resolution.  There may be more charges pending from some new referrals.  State believes that, as of this morning, they have all of the information to make a global offer and do not object to an adjournment.  State believes everything could be completed within 2 weeks.  This matter to tag along with 14CF859 for further scheduling.  Court will allow enough time at the next hearing for a change of plea if the global resolution is reached.  Court orders defendant may have 1 free phone call to Teen Challenge to see if he is eligible.  The phone call should last about 32 minutes.  Hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
